Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Desiccant \De*sic"cant\, a. [L. desiccans, p. pr. of desiccare. See {Desiccate}.] Drying; desiccative. -- n. (Med.) A medicine or application for drying up a sore. --Wiseman. [1913 Webster]
desiccant n : a substance that promotes drying (e.g., calcium oxide absorbs water and is used to remove moisture) [syn: {drying agent}, {drier}, {sicative}]
